net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupClientCon

    public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConnectionI
    Basic, abstract implementation of ConnectionI. This is just a helper class that leaves sending and receiving of messages up to the implementing class. Connection is backed by a Queue for storing received messages. The implementing class can call the protected method addMsgToQueue to add a received message to the queue. Calling pollNextMsg polls from the queue.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ConnectionI

    • Field Detail

      • BROADCAST_CONNECTION

        public static final long BROADCAST_CONNECTION
        This is primarily used as the connectionId when calling HubI.sendMsg(MarkupMsg, long). If the hub supports broadcasting messages then usually the supplied message is passed to HubI.broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg)
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        HubI, HubI.sendMsg(MarkupMsg, long), HubI.broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg), Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection(long id)
        Constructs a new instance with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - value returned by getId()
        See Also:
        getId()

      • Connection

        public Connection(long id,
          java.util.Queue<MarkupMsg> receivedQueue)
        Constructs a new instance with the given id. The given Queue object is used to store received messages. Messages are added to this queue by calling addMsgToQueue(MarkupMsg) and read by calling pollNextMsg().
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the connection
        receivedQueue - the received messages queue

    • Method Detail

      • sendMsg

        public abstract boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg msg)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionI
        Sends a MarkupMsg. Depending on the implementing class, the message could be set across a TCP stream, file stream, or some other medium.

        Implementations are free to determine how to send messages. The protocol for sending messages is also defined by the implementation.

        Specified by:
        sendMsg in interface ConnectionI
        Parameters:
        msg - message to send across the connection
        Returns:
        true if the sending the message was successful, false otherwise. It does not guarantee that the message was received.

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionI
        Each connection has a unique id that allows others to distinguish between connections
        Specified by:
        getId in interface ConnectionI
        Returns:
        the unique id associated with this connection

      • pollNextMsg

        public MarkupMsg pollNextMsg()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionI
        Removes and returns a received message. Messages are returned in FIFO order. So messages received earlier will be returned before messages received latter. Be aware that received messages are not guaranteed to be in the order they were sent.

        this method should only return null if isMsgAvailable() returns false

        In most situations, one ConnectionI will send a message to another ConnectionI. The received message can be read by calling pollNextMsg().

        Specified by:
        pollNextMsg in interface ConnectionI
        Returns:
        the next available MarkupMsg or null if there are no messages to poll

      • isMsgAvailable

        public boolean isMsgAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionI
        Returns whether message has been received and can be returned by calling pollNextMsg()
        Specified by:
        isMsgAvailable in interface ConnectionI
        Returns:
        true if pollNextMsg() will not return null

      • addMsgToQueue

        protected void addMsgToQueue(MarkupMsg msg)
        Connection has a queue for storing received messages. Received messages can be added to this queue by calling this method. Calling pollNextMsg() polls items added the queue.
        Parameters:
        msg - message to be added to the queue
        See Also:
        pollNextMsg()
